asgn2RollingStock

Class Locomotive

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn2RollingStock.RollingStock
      • asgn2RollingStock.Locomotive

  • public class Locomotive
extends RollingStock
    A locomotive is a railway carriage with the ability to propel itself and pull (or push) other carriages. Thus the primary distinguishing characteristic of a locomotive is how much weight it can pull.
    Author:
    Connor Livsey - n8510873

    • Constructor Detail

      • Locomotive

        public Locomotive(java.lang.Integer grossWeight,
          java.lang.String classification)
           throws TrainException
        Constructs a new locomotive object with a fixed gross weight and classification code.
        Parameters:
        grossWeight - Integer: the locomotive's (fully-laden) weight in tonnes.
        classification - String: the locomotive's two-character classification code.
        Throws:
        TrainException - the locomotive's (fully-laden) weight in tonnes

    • Method Detail

      • isInteger

        public static boolean isInteger(char input)

      • classificationCheck

        private boolean classificationCheck(java.lang.String classCode)
        Checks inputed classCode to determine valid input.
        Parameters:
        classCode - String: the locomotive's two-character classification code.
        Returns:
        boolean: True if classCode is matched.

      • power

        public java.lang.Integer power()
        Returns how much total weight the locomotive can pull (including itself).
        Returns:
        Integer: the locomotive's "pulling power" in tonnes.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-readable description of the locomotive. This has the form "Loco(x)" where x is the locomotive's two-character classification code.
        Specified by:
        toString in class RollingStock
        Returns:
        String: a human-readable description of the locomotive.
        See Also:
        RollingStock.toString()
